channel.title: International CES News
channel.description: Stay up-to-date on the latest developments for 2011 International CES attendees.

item.title: Senator Tom Coburn M.D., Representative Anna Eshoo and Dr. Robert Kahn to be Honored at CEA's Digital Patriots Dinner
item.description: May 11 Digital Patriots Awards Dinner to Benefit the D.C. Opportunity Scholarship Program

item.title: 2011 Mark of Excellence Award Winners Announced
item.description: The Consumer Electronics Association (CEA) today announced the winners of the 2011 Mark of Excellence Awards.

item.title: CEA's Gary Shapiro Encourages Consumer Technology Companies to Participate in Upcoming CE Week
item.description: CEA president calls the New York event the right place and time to prepare media and trade for all-important Q4 product launches and holiday messaging.

item.title: 2012 CES iLounge Pavilion Sells Out in Record Time: Additional Space Added to Meet Demand
item.description: 50,000 Square Feet of 2012 CES iLounge Exhibit Space Already Sold; Pavilion to Feature Largest Display of iPad, iPhone, iPod and Apple Products in CES History

item.title: 2011 International CES Wows World with Innovation and Optimism
item.description: Record-breaking 30,000 overseas visitors experience world’s largest consumer technology tradeshow.

item.title: Missed A CES Keynote? Watch Them All Online
item.description: Want to know where consumer technology is headed in 2011? Watch any or all of the 2011 CES keynote addresses.

item.title: MyCES and the Online Exhibitor Directory Generate More than a Million Company Listing Views
item.description: Together, MyCES and the online exhibitor directory have generated more than a million company listing views and over 160,000 sales leads, proving their usefulness as key attendee planning tools.

item.title: Keynotes from Ford, Cisco, GE, Xerox and the Entertainment Community Top Day Two of the 2011 CES
item.description: FCC Chairman Genachowski Discusses Broadband, Spectrum Reform and Competition Policy with CEA’s Shapiro

item.title: Microsoft Keynote and Major Product Announcements Kick Off 2011 CES
item.description: Ballmer keynote and pre-CES media events fuel momentum for the 2011 CES

item.title: CEA's Gary Shapiro Available for Book Signings On-site at CES
CEA Releases Sustainability Report, Highlights Tremendous Progress Industry has Made in Green Initiatives
item.description: The CEA 2010 Sustainability Report contains 21 separate case studies from a variety of CE companies illustrating progress in their environmental efforts.

item.title: Celebrities Promote Latest Consumer Technology and Trends at CES
item.description: Television personalities, sports icons, award winning-actors and government officials will attend the 2011 International CES to showcase and discuss the innovative products and technologies shaping consumer technology.

item.title: Huffington Post Co-founder and Editor-in-Chief Arianna Huffington Featured Speaker, Along with Netflix Keynoter Hastings, at the 2011 CES LIT Dinner
item.description: This invitation-only dinner brings top technology industry leaders and government guests together to share their experience and knowledge.

item.title: Foursquare at the 2011 International CES
With a Week to Go Before CES, Exhibitors May Need These Helpful Kits and Resources
item.description: The best way to stay organized as you prep for CES is to have every resource at your fingertips.

item.title: Vegas Properties Offer Deep Discounts for CES Goers
item.description: Looking for a deal on a Vegas show? Want that all-you-can-eat buffet at half the price? Chek out these offers.

item.title: Six Sessions to Round Out Your Four Days at CES
item.description: If you don't have time to attend an entire track offered in the CES Conference Program, you may want to opt for these sponsored single sessions.

item.title: New Sessions added to CES Conference Program Highlight Fitness, Cloud Computing, Smartphones and More
item.description: Take a look a these new programs brought to you by CES partners who have produced popular sessions in the past, and sign up now to save.

item.title: Social Media Expands CES
item.description: Tradeshows are primarily about bringing people face-to-face to network and conduct business. Social networking tools can help make this happen by better connecting people.

item.title: Making the Home Connection
item.description: By Sue Schreiner from the November/December 2010 issue of Vision Magazine

item.title: Team LightBulb, Clasma Events and Parnassus to Produce New Sessions for 2011 CES Conference Program
item.description: Making last-minute decisions on your 2011 CES schedule? Consider these conference program tracks from new partners!

item.title: Pre-order Now Available for The Comeback: How Innovation will Restore the American Dream
item.description: In The Comeback, Gary Shapiro shows us how to return innovation to its rightful place at the center of America’s economic policy. The Comeback is a new blueprint for America’s success.

item.title: Broadband Communications – New Ways to Relieve Capacity Woes
item.description: Broadband communications capabilities are increasingly stressed by the demand for high-bandwidth applications such as video, videoconferencing, telemedicine and cloud computing.

item.title: Boomers Boost Your Bottom Line
item.description: There are about 78 million boomers in the US (450 million worldwide) born between 1946 and 1964 — and they're hitting their peak earning and spending.

item.title: Media Money Makers: Turn Content Into Cash
item.description: Media Money Makers, co-sponsored by The Nielsen Co., cuts through the technobabble to reveal reliable business models for monetizing content across the most promising platforms.

item.title: CEA Launches Tech Enthusiast Membership for Individuals
item.description: For the first time in its 86-year history, the Consumer Electronics Association (CEA) has created a membership category exclusively for individuals who are early adopters and fervent supporters of consumer technology.

item.title: On-air Promotional Opportunities at CES with Dave Graveline
item.description: Covering the latest in consumer electronics, "Into Tomorrow with Dave Graveline" will launch their 16th year at the International CES in January.

item.title: Mashable Awards Come to CES
item.description: Mashable is proud to present the fourth annual Mashable Awards, which celebrates major innovations and achievements in the digital and social media landscape.

item.title: The National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences Announced Recipients of 62nd Annual Technology and Engineering Emmy Awards to Take Place at CES
item.description: The National Academy’s prestigious Lifetime Achievement Award in Technology and Engineering will be presented to Sir Howard Stringer, Chairman and CEO of Sony Corporation.

item.title: Living in Digital Times Announced Keynote Speakers for Lifestyle Tracks at 2011 CES
item.description: The lifestyle conference tracks taking place at the 2011 CES focus on the fastest-growing technology consumer markets – from parents and children, to students, young adults, and seniors.
